meanings.sent1: The young couple would osculate under the moonlight.

meanings.definition: To touch or join at the edge or boundary.
meanings.sent1: The two puzzle pieces would osculate perfectly, completing the picture.
meanings.sent2: The walls of the old house would osculate where they met at the corner.

meanings.sent4: The branches of the trees would osculate in the gentle breeze.

meanings.definition: To have a common tangent or osculating circle.
meanings.sent1: The two curves would osculate at the point of intersection.
meanings.sent2: In geometry, circles can osculate at a single point.
meanings.sent3: The math problem required finding where the two lines would osculate.
